title: If you see your support as "expendable" because of thier champion selection...
body:
Dont turn around and get mad at them for not wanting to support you!. 

I am seeing this More and more. Players who follow the meta like its thier bible. Anyone who legitimately tries to win by playing an Off meta support. 
I just got out of a match where I went MF support. ADC repeatedly ignored pings for help. And I was told "you went MF 'support' " 
So because of my champion selection, I am instantly treated as a tumour to be removed and cut off from everyone else. 
I am really getting sick of this Mob mentality, Where if you are going against the meta, no matter how genuine your intention, the community goes out of thier way to create a self fulfilling prophecys. They will do everything in thier power to make you out what they label you. 

Like a player who calls you a feeder. 
then spends the entire game ignoring you when you ping for help. When you get ambushed the player just looks the other way. Or feints going in and waits for follow up, only to back out at the last second when its too late for you. 
Then spends each death going "See? see? I told you this player was a feeder"

You have a player you designated as the "other" (feeder/troll/flamer/etc) and so you spend the entire game poking and prodding, Making sure that the "other" ends up exactly how you want them to. 
You labeled them a troll so anything they do is twisted into a form of "trolling" regardless of intent. 
You labeled them a feeder so you ignore when they need help and Laugh when they die because It helps validate your label on them. 


Again, got hung out to dry because I went MF support. Apparently the player didnt care or know, but designated it as trolling anyways. Ignored pings for help when the enemy bot lane pounced on me (ADC had abandoned lane and ran mid for kills). ADC ignored pings for help but was happy to label me a feeder/troll because "you went MF "support" "

This falls in line with the earlier thread I made. About how Supports are treated as NOT PART OF THE TEAM. 
When they ping? its brushed off
when they need help, it gets ignored.
When the match is lost, its automatically their fault. 

I have been told by adcs "ur job is to die so adc can live"
and yet again these same adcs will talk about how much of a "troll feeder" support is. 

So Consider this fair warning. If you want to treat me as expendable, dont get mad and throw a tantrum when I decide Not to waste my time buying sightstone, support items, or providing vision. Its a waste if all the adc is gonna do is throw support to the enemy team to save thier own skin then turn around and go "wtf support, STOP DYING! OMG Report the troll Feeding support" 

I am a support
I am NOT your verbal punching bag
I am NOT your personal Lane slave
I am NOT YOUR MEAT SHIELD
and I am definately most assuredly NOT YOUR SCAPEGOAT.
If you dont even see your support as part of the team, then they have no obligation to provide vision for you. 
So I guess the team will actually have to learn to buy more wards.

replies.body:
I have had ADCs that purposly let me die. Or bait me into an enguage just to turn around, run, wait fir me to die, then turn around again to secure a double.

Sure if anyone needs the kills its the ADC. But by purposly letting me die, you are allowing the enemy team access to more gold that could have been prevented from them getting. 

Even worse is when that very same ADC bitches at you for feeding or for you standing back and not following them into their enguages after.

I have also had the duspleaure of having an entire team backstab each other in the same way for glory and kills.

Yeah there are certain types of players that I just cant stand. The worst are the Adcs who act like support plays NO PART in them getting fed.

They are happy to take all the credit and brag about all the kills they got. But in the same breath will turn around and talk about how USELESS supports are. When it was the SUPPORT who saved them from getting taken out in 3 shots, the support who pulled enemies off so they could get away, who leashed the enemy down to 5 % heath so that the adc could jump in and kill them with a sneeze. 
But no, they dont see support as having any worth at all, the support is just there when they need someone to blame, a scapegoat for reports. 

I had an adc rage at me because he was at like 2-hits, and he decided to DIVE IN and try and score a DOUBLE.... on a FULL HEALTH VAYNE and a FULL HEALTH LEONA
I was OOM and backing. So he dives in, dies (naturally) and flips out and tells me how its my fault he died because I didnt go dive in with him. So he started calling for reports on me over /all. 

as I said, they will label  you a troll/feeder/whatever
and then go out of thier way to realise that self fulfilling prophecy.
If they see you needing help, they will ignore you. 
If they see you do anything they didnt approve prior, they will label  you a troll. (You go in to ward a bush, get ambushed and die. All of a sudden you see "OMG report my support, Troll intentional feeder")
THey have labelled you a troll and/or feeder and will do anything to make sure that they can "validate" the label. 
THen they can go all over telling every single player new and old how you are a troll feeder, which implants that notion in thier head and the cycle continues.

Totally agreed with your opinion.

ADC's that accept off-meta support picks are very rare (while the rest of the team don't blame you for this, usually), even got threatened because I picked one of the meta supps (Brand), while the ADC only wanted Leona to supp him.
You state that ADC's often blame supports for their own fails. True, when they don't blame the jungler first. Seems that kind of ADC's do not have the intellectual capacity to realize that hard blaming a guy won't encourage him to do better. I just leave the lane to roam where the jungler goes, then mute + report the ADC at the end.

I'm still convinced there is still some kind ADC players that won't judge their support for his pick or his playstyle, etc. But for now I'm only playing supp if a friend plays ADC, and if I play alone, i lock an another lane, so I can avoid playing with random ADC's.

By the way, I'm a support main. I also almost play everytime off-meta supports as Jarvan IV, etc, because of their strong spell kit on a 2-players lane that allow efficient engages, good CC, and because they got a great mobility, peel potential, and utility.

Oh yes I have had the rare occation where I had an accepting adc. I Had 2 games where my adc didnt at least outright flame me for going Support veigar (Spoiler alert: won both those matches)
http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/2349142074/208561365?tab=overview

But the match before those I had a "Funda-META-list" 
My adc was a kalista, refusing to even try. She ran away from lane early. Blamed me for the loss. I got 4 kills because whenever I managed to lock the enemy down on last hit, Kalista would wander off to farm minions.
She basically stopped playing in order to "punish me" for not playing a proper "meta" champ, then turned around and wanted to report me for "trolling"

I have a simple way of seeing things. which is probably why I get so much flak.
If  you flame someone for small mistakes, it stresses them out and causes them to make bigger mistakes. Flame them for bigger mistakes, and there is no end to how big your problems become.

 Flame a player for making a mistake -----> Player gets stressed ------> Player makes more mistakes ------> Flame a player for those NEW mistakes------------------> Repeat cycle -------> Lose the match.

all because people expect every game to play like a flawless LCS world championship final. 
They expect thier team to play like robots, not human beings.

I am sorry you died and ADC got 2 kills and stayed alive? 
why are you upset?

Also, ADC had to bait you into it? Take some initiative that's a good trade start it yourself. Don't be a pussy.

Its more of a case of when instead of helping YOU, The adc will -intentionally- wait. They are in the perfect position to help. But that means they may not get BOTH the kills. There is a chance the support may accidentally get a kill so the adc intentionally waits, allows support to die. AND THEN jumps in to grab the double. 

"If I help you, that means less kills for ME"

If an adc is that eager to throw thier support to the enemy for the sake of "well that means i have to share the kills" then I would have no interest in supporting them, knowing they would happily throw me under the bus if it meant they could climb that 'corpse-ladder'

that is what the problem is. You were playing with someone and they said "well I -could- help you, But I wont" and then after you are dead, they jump in, score a double and start bragging "Omg a Double, how great am I. This useless support is no help!, Report the feeder"

sounds like an awesome teammate, doesnt it.

To be honest with you, I did not encounter this kind of behavior. Maybe I am too bad at knowing my ADC's cool-downs to recognize it. 

Generally when i get a "I am dead and now my ADC goes ham and kills shit", it is because enemy lane blew principle damage skills on trying to kill me. I recognize four situations - one where the enemy has high value skills and the ADC is scared to go in as long as these skills are up (legitimate), and second scenario when someone dies and everybody goes "fight! fight! fight!" and the situation just devolves (yes i know this is in bronze). Thirdly, the ADC is just shit and miss plays everything, and fourth - he gets caught by surprise and is paralyzed for a second. 

These scenarios happen a lot more than "if i help the support he'll grab one of them kills, i'd better throw him under bus first". to such an extent that while I've experienced a lot of "KS KS cancer report" and RQs from ADCs, I have never seen it.

I have been told many times (as a support) by an adc

"You are support, your job is to die for your adc. If adc is about to die, it is your job to take the death so adc can get fed" 

And these same people will turn around in the same match and say "our Support is intentionally feeding, please report them. 

Or they will ignore my pings/warnings because "you got no kills"
But the moment I (As a support) get a kill, Adc Loses thier minds "OMG THIS TROLL SUPPORT TAKING MY KILLS! Report!"

People want supports to keep them safe, but use them as a personal punching bag for the entire laning phase, berate them degrade them, ignore them. Leave them to die then turn around and call them feeders" 
And  they expect Support players not to be a little cheesed after a while of being talked down to like they arent actually on the team. To just sit there and take it or be labeled a troll/feeder/etc
It is your job to die for the adc, stop being Bronze lol.

Yeah I often play j4 support and every few matches those meta nazi players complain about me going with an off meta pick. Poppy support is not currently meta I think but people don't complain about that. I am pretty sure riot has a rule that says you are not allowed to shame someone for an off-meta pick.

People dont care about rules, they dont want to help people improve. The Funda-Meta-lists are so wrapped up in enforcing the meta that they dont care about the rules, just thier "I get to tell you what to play" buzz. Its like these people get a sick high when they go around and spend more time telling the rest of thier team
"you CAN play this...No you cant play that champ, ur not allowed....NO NO UR NOT ALLOWED TO BUILD THAT ITEM. Here I will tell you what Items you are allowed to build!" 
and ifyou build anything outside it, or have an individual strategy in mind "OMG TROLL TROOOOOOLLL ur Trolling"
I bet even North Korea would tell these guys to ease up a bit.
To be fair, if you aren't building sightstone as a support, there's a good chance you're doing it wrong

There is a difference between "being the shield" and going in then my adc runs in the opposite direction with no option to jump out leaving me in a 1vs2 or even 3vs2... then getting called feeder. We are not talking about just dying but purposely being led into a trap by your own adc and then being shamed in teamchat or all chat.

i usually report this behavior as harrassment and i got a notepad open for these occasions all the time to note down match time... that's how paranoid i got being trapped by my adc

In that case.
you are the person who is supposed to have the functioning brain in the team.
just dont go in.

Yeah, playing support often means you have to use all your tools in your disposal for someone else, which  in turn means your deaths are often the result of shotcalls. Often supports can die for something as little as poor minion manipulation. And the role will consistently be difficult to coordinate if you don't know the person you're laning with, but there's not much you can do except be kind, helpful when possible, and report people who break the summoner's code thing. And as far as going for off meta supports, that one is a little difficult. I guess just post in champ select chat that you want to do it and ask if it's okay? You may get shot down even if it's a really good matchup but instalocking anyway makes you no better than a troll, regardless of the outcome. Unfortunately as a support the team comes first. So if you're queuing alone, it's probably better just to stick to the meta until you have someone to back you up in any oddball decisions. (even though MF sup isn't that weird, and everyone should know about that now)

Yeah, it sucks when people complain about vision and you have all your sightstone wards out and a pink/controlward. Hopefully they will add a ping option to show how many ward you have on the map (although I don't know how they'd implement that). People will consistently be jerks, but how we deal with them is what matters.

Anyway, good luck out there on the rift, and don't destroy my ctrl wards damnnit I paid good money for those!

It generally doesnt matter if I follow the meta or not, Because more and more support role is being treated like they arent actually part of the team. If they ping, it gets brushed off. If Adc dies, its supports fault. Game is lost? its supports fault. Any strategy support has, is meaningless/worthless, 

I have pinged Bot lane tower when I see enemy bot coming in to destroy it, No help at all. no one looks, no one even pings back. They just keep on moving. 
Only after first bot tower is gone, I am barely hanging on to life behind second tower does someone finally notice that an enemy is missing and sends someone bot.. In the end, I get blamed for the loss because I am "just a useless support" when I was trying to defend bot lane solo while the rest of the team was off chasing kills pretending support doesnt exist. 

As for Off meta support. I think its a 2 way street. Yeah maybe I will listen to the team when they stop treating support like some bag of dirt they can just kick around "do what I say or I report  you for trolling".
I DO play Support veigar. and have rather good games 
http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/2349142074/208561365?tab=overview

But I get people who expect me to bend over backwards for them, but wont even hear what I have to say. I could explain till I am blue and the face and its "stfu, ur support. Play a REAL SUPPORT". 

But no, as for the ward thing. I am saying if I am so disposeable of a role as support that my adcs constantly tell me "your job is to die! So adc can get fed!"
Well then I guess I should stop wasting my money on Support items like wards, sightstones/shields. Stop wasting my energy with summoners spells meant to heal/help the adc. If my value to the team is so little. 
And keep in mind, these are things that have ACTUALLY BEEN SAID TO ME. 
Mostly by Draven players.

You played MF into Caitlyn+Kench and Jinx+Nunu and **ultra fed** both times...  I wouldn't bother trying to help you either.

Stop trying to cash in on the ADC hate, you actually ARE ruining games with your trash builds and poor champion selection.

Its cute how you act as if you understand My motives. Oh so cute I just want to pinch your cheeks. 

You fail to understand that it is a team game, If the adc has an attitude where the team is "unworthy" to be saved, you cannot turn around and label them as an intentional feeder. "Oh you didnt play who/how/what I wanted you to play, so I will not save you" You Can if you want, but you cant turn around and say  "its your fault I CHOSE not to help you, because you played MF Support"

And yeah, I have more than enough adc hate, trying to help entitled adcs who turn around and spit in my eye because they 
A) dont understand my intentions or strategy
B) Dont Care to KNOW about My intentions or strategy
C) Not once ask WHY I was building what I was building
D) would rather remain comfortable in thier sense of superiority, where they know -everything-, they know WHO everyone should Play, How everyone should play, what items everyone should build. 

You call my builds trash, You never once asked why I built what I did, you dont suggest alternatives. You just sit there and act like anyone who doesnt build like you, anyone who doesnt play like you, is automatically -intentionally- out to ruin peoples games. 

So No, YOU dont get to decide how I play my game, YOU dont get to decide which builds are "Trash builds" based on YOUR own smug opinion, and YOU dont get to decide what everyone else plays. 
Games are lost because people like you are too busy telling EVERYONE ELSE ON THE TEAM How to play thier games, rather than just focussing on your own champ. So, when are you buying the plane tickets to come and play my game for me.

Didn't read your wall of text.

You're feeding, building poorly, AND picking dumb champs. You **ARE** a problem. 
Whether you want to admit that or not doesn't interest me.

Why admit what isnt true. Its your OPINION. And Everyone has one. I never once saw you suggest alternative items. But you are just like most in this community. Why suggest better alternatives when you can just shine a spotlight on people and try and turn them into something to laugh at. 

So no, I dont have to admit anything. You think I am the problem, good for you. Want a cookie?
Other than that you have just come to this thread to try and score internet points.

It's not an opinion, you're a liability to your team with those champs/items that you **continue** to use. You know they're not good, you know they have no "support" value, you just want people to side with you because they always side with supports. 

The fact here is that you are likely **directly** responsible for a lot of those losses and you just don't want to accept that.
Again, fine with me, literally makes no difference to me. But you WILL keep losing if you keep doing it.

So, I'll try to be a neutral party in this to perhaps help out a bit. 

I agree with both of you, so let me explain.

Zero Suit Thea is technically right when it comes to building poorly and picking non-optimal champions into a support role. This can indeed cause a problem, and can usually be rude towards your teammates who may not want that. This can also agitate your team and get blame shifted onto you quickly if you are not performing as well as a traditional support would.

**However**, this mostly applies to ranked since the stakes are much higher, and players want their team playing at their best. Especially since these are random strangers who don't know your skill with said build/champ and intent when it comes to playing something off-meta or different. 

Looking at your match history, Damagefox, you usually play normals with some ranked. This is where I agree with you that what you're playing is not an issue and is perfectly okay to test builds and play off-meta supports that normally may not work well in. Normals are meant for experimenting and having fun, so no one should be flaming you or expecting perfection in such a game. Players should be respectful towards your choices when playing normals since that mode is meant for that. How can anyone learn what works and doesn't work if they aren't allowed to play it?

However, in Ranked, please be considerate towards your teammates (not just the ADC) when it comes to playing something many don't normally see or are used to.

I'm not saying either of you are right, but neither are you two wrong. I am just trying to point out that there are acceptable times for off-meta builds/strategies/supports, and times where you may need to play something more optimal to help your team win. 

Also, keep in mind it is best to let others know ahead of time what you want to play if it's off-meta or unheard of if you do decide to take it to Ranked. I myself like playing off-meta supports (used to play Sej support and Jhin Support), but usually I try to be polite to my team and ask if they're okay with it before I select. Same goes for strategies that aren't normally seen like duo jungle or duo top.

Just my thoughts though.
Your best bet is to find a good ADC to duo with that is okay with off meta picks for support.
Its gotten so bad I really cant trust most (if not all) adcs.

Yeah those good players that stay with the game and are not toxic are hard to find sometimes. Right now there are like 4 people I trust that I can que up with. And like 3 others I trust but I haven't really qued with them much. They usually trust me for my jungling skills or support skills for one of them.
All supports are expendable. They exist only to be carried.
No you unbelievable twat

I've had this happen to me rather often. Not often enough for it to seriously affect me, but enough to get under my skin.

I always go into the Support role with the mentality of "I will throw myself in front of my teammate if it means their survival. However, if being the scapegoat of the situation will still result in their death, I will always choose to live and simply support another teammate for the time being".

I never support just my adc. I support every ally I have when applicable. Because of this, I've had adc's crying to /all, talking about "please report this support. afk up in mid/top lane and not doing their job."

All the while, I'm just sitting there thinking "How? How am I not doing my job? The river's warded for you, there was no one around prior to my leaving the lane, and our top/mid needed some assistance. Our jungler had just backed so he couldn't get there in time. You got caught out [or just plain killed] for not keeping passive til I got back to you. Not my fault."

I also had a game, recently, where I was Taric supporting an Ezreal. There was a point where he and I were chasing down the enemy Wukong who was low on HP and Mana (killable) and the Caitlyn who was low on mana (not as killable, but killable). All was fine until I noticed that the enemy's fed Leblanc had just respawned. We were about around where the 2nd tier mid tower is. Upon noticing her respawn, I pinged 3 times for Ezreal to back off and began to turn away from him, expecting him to follow. Instead of leaving, he chose to keep chasing Wukong, leading to his death by the hands (Scepter) of Leblanc. He then went into chat with "wow, can't believe Leblanc is so fed."

Like, "wow. had you just listened to my pings and ran, you wouldn't have to worry about how fed she is." I'm seriously sick of no one listening to my pings when I play Support. I swear, 99.9% of my pings get ignored while I'm playing Support. Supporting randoms is not fun when they act like this.

I honestly could care less what someone supports as. What tilts me off the face of the earth is when the support basically AFKs in lane and is just an experience sink. As a support you should punishing the enemy ADC when he moves forward to CS and zoning the enemy support from trying to punish me as I CS. Multiple times in ranked games I've asked my support if he was lagging because he wasn't doing anything and his response was "sorry, I was checking facebook." Checking Facebook in a freaking ranked game.

I never understood ADCs that freak out when their support gets a kill. A kill is a kill. I'd much rather we kill them fast so I still have enough health to safely push out the lane without worrying about the jungler appearing and finishing me off.

Before you assume the support is trolling you should always check out their op.gg. I've had some people pick some weird support picks before and then I check their op.gg and find they've got a 70%+ win rate with it. Let someone's actions speak louder than their champion pick.

I am constantly trying to set up poke for my ADC. I play Support veigar and am constantly trying to box the enemy in (fish in a barrel?). I dont just sit and afk, I am watching the map, seeing where enemies are going, where they are coming from. Are enemies missing? are they grouping? Is dragon/baron up?

as for the kill, its an ego thing I think. I have gotten a kill and the team would freak out telling me that "ur support, supports arent supposed to take kills. They give the kills to thier team." And yet when I ping dragon/baron. or warn of an incoming gank. 
I warned a draven of a gank, pinged the river and backed up. Draven didnt and ended up dying to the very gank I was trying to warn him of. When I asked why he didnt back up, the answer i got was "Stfu, u got no kills"
So...my lack of kills means that its ok to brush off my pings, then turn around and /all "my trash support, so useless" to the other team. 

Most of these players want "Most kills", if someone else gets a kill, it is treated like "Hey now, thats one LESS KILL FOR ME!" which is often why people flip out and call KS. A sort of "All kills are mine by default" mentality. So if someone takes a kill and didnt ask for it, well thats stealing.
